channel.title: learning on The Unhandled Exception Podcast
channel.description: Recent content in learning on The Unhandled Exception Podcast

item.title: Episode 77: Shawn Wildermuth
item.description: In this episode, I was delighted to be joined by Shawn Wildermuth. We chatted about software development in general, careers, AI, and more! Shawn Wildermuth is a software development consultant, Microsoft MVP, Pluralsight author, and speaker with over 30 years of experience in the industry. Shawn’s social links Website YouTube Bluesky LinkedIn GitHub Pluralsight Courses Links from the show Hello World film Vue.js .NET Aspire episode with Maddy Dan’s Aspire Dometrain course VSCode agent mode XMind Steve Smith’s episode talking about modular monoliths If you’re enjoying the podcast, please remember to subscribe and share this episode with your friends and colleagues!

item.title: Episode 58: Dometrain - with Nick Chapsas
item.description: In this episode, I was joined for the second time by Nick Chapsas! This time, we chatted about his new Dometrain teaching platform. Nick started off creating courses on his own website, nickchapsas.com, which he’s recently rebranded to Dometrain and reached out to other authors to also create courses - myself included! I’ve recently released a Docker course on Dometrain, and we chatted about my experience doing this, as well as Nick’s story and motivations behind building Dometrain.

item.title: Episode 48: Coffee and Code - with Isaac Levin
item.description: In this episode, I was joined by Isaac Levin that chat about… way too many things to put in an episode title, that’s for sure! ðŸ˜‚ We decided to not have a particular topic in mind - and just chat and see where the conversation took us! We ended up talking about podcasting, working remotely and the pandemic, general career stuff, public speaking, containers, AWS, learning, mindsets, guitars, and more!

item.title: Episode 30: Developer Productivity with (me!) Dan Clarke
item.description: Developer productivity is something I’ve been really interested in for quite a few years. So I decided, rather than having a guest on for this topic - it’s one I wanted to cover myself. So in this first episode of the year - I’ve gone solo, and talk about the things I find have made a big difference to my productivity over the years. Also why I think this term “10x developer” is a big understatement!

item.title: Episode 16: Learning and Self Development with James World
item.description: In this episode, I was joined by James World to chat about learning! We covered an incredible amount in this episode - from certifications, to books and reading, interviews, what it means to be a senior developer, and much much more! Links from the show James' Links Twitter LinkedIn (please include a note in your connection request so you stand out from the recruiter bots! Maybe a book recommendation?
